definition: to come when called (idiom); ready and compliant/always at sb's beck and call
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
variant of 呼[hu1]/to shout/to call out
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
namely/that is/i.e./prompt/at once/at present/even if/prompted (by the occasion)/to approach/to come into contact/to assume (office)/to draw near
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to come when called (idiom); ready and compliant/always at sb's beck and call
pinyin: hu1 zhi1 ji2 lai2 , hui1 zhi1 ji2 qu4

sentences.english: He is very obedient and always at beck and call, never daring to delay a moment.
sentences.chinese: 他很听话，总是呼之即来，不敢有半点耽搁。

definition: to be available at any time/to be on call
to come when called (idiom); ready and compliant/always at sb's beck and call

to call to come and shout to go (idiom); to yell orders/always bossing people around
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
to grant whatever is asked for/to accede to every plea
a hundred answers to a single call (idiom)/to respond en masse

(metaphorical) punching bag/undeserving target of sb's wrath

to follow obediently
